title: Recording device found in Gosforth Academy toilets
text:
Recording equipment has been found in the toilets of a Tyneside school.
A school employee has been arrested following the discovery in the staff toilets at Gosforth Academy in Newcastle. Police have confirmed the man, 53, was not a member of the teaching staff.
Newcastle City Council released a statement to say, at this stage, this is no information to suggest the incident affects students.
Police have made an arrest Credit: ITV “A 53-year-old male former employee has been arrested on suspicion of a voyeurism offence at Gosforth Academy. There is no information at this stage to suggest that the incidents involve or affect any of the students. Police investigations are ongoing and it would therefore not be appropriate to comment any further.”
– Council spokesperson "On January 26, police received a report that a recording device had been found in a staff toilet at Gosforth Academy.
"A 53-year-old man, who was a school employee but not a member of teaching staff, was arrested in connection with the incident and an investigation is ongoing."
– Northumbria Police Gosforth Newcastle
